item.title: 10 - social share
item.description:
10 - social share

My aim for this one was to show the whole "this network has x posts, this one has y posts" etc. Not sure it really works, the whole circle motif is starting to really bleed into my designs

item.title: 9 - music player
item.description:
9 - music player

This is the shit, absolutely loved doing this one. Shout out to Rivers of Nihil - what a crushing album to end 2015

8 - 404

I once created an entire system ui with just typography. People didn't like it because it "wasted too much real estate", but I absolutely loved it. This is a small homage to that

item.title: 7 - settings
item.description:
7 - settings

I really liked doing this one. It's pretty much in line with a lot of the flat design work I've been doing professionally

item.title: 6 - user profile
item.description:
6 - user profile

Hmm. This is meant to be a pretty simple twitter profile, turned out to be a little bit less good than I hoped

item.title: 5 - app icon
item.description:
5 - app icon

This is an icon for a theoretical physiotherapy app featuring a design I did for thestudiophysio.com - really damn simple

item.title: 4 - calculator
item.description:
4 - calculator

Unfortunately a product of laziness, this one. Derivative of the style I used in the first couple (as if that wasn't obvious)

item.title: 3 - landing page
item.description:
3 - landing page

I haven't really done a whole lot of actual web stuff, so making a landing page is pretty interesting. Although with this one I think I've pretty much just followed the leader - simple header, call to action (that's a bit unbalanced) and some guidance to keep going down the page.

item.title: 2 - credit card confirmation
item.description:
2 - credit card confirmation

yeah, much the same as yesterday - some pretty simple colours and details. I'm not so happy with some of the detail in the fields, or the spacing between the fields. I'd fix that up if I went back to this.

item.title: 1 - signup
item.description:
1 - signup

So, time to start this mega journey with something pretty simple. My background is mostly as a software developer, but I've spent a large amount of my life and career doing ui design.It's probably not hard to tell that I'm really into flat/minimal design these days. So, let's see if I can improve some stuff
